p:
The Baccam II Model [ 13, 22] contains one more species than the Baccam Model presented in the methods section above. That is, there are now two types of infected cells: those which do not yet produce viruses
I 1
and those which actively produce viruses
I 2
. In addition, there is only one new reaction, which transforms infected cells of type
I 1
into type
I 2
at rate
k
I 1
( Figure 4a). However, the Hasse diagram of organizations remains the same when compared with the basic Baccam Model [ 13].
